instantiate

public java.lang.Object instantiate(ObjectInstantiation oi)
                             throws java.lang.Throwable
Description copied from interface: InstantiationInterceptor
This callback method will be automatically invoked in order to instantiate bean instance.

The returned bean instance may be a wrapper around the previous result (the bean instance was instantiated by previous InstantiationInterceptor. In order to get the previous object instance, access to metadata of given ObjectInstantiation object.

ex: ObjectInstantiation.getMetadata(MetadataKey.PREVIOUS_RESULT);

Specified by:
instantiate in interface InstantiationInterceptor
Parameters:
oi - the ObjectInstantiation
Returns:
the object bean
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable
See Also:
MetadataKey

setProvider

public void setProvider(Provider provider)
Description copied from interface: ProviderAware
Callback that supplies the owning factory to a bean instance. Invoked after the population of normal bean properties but before an initialization callback such as Initializing.activate() or a custom init-method.

Specified by:
setProvider in interface ProviderAware
Parameters:
provider - owning Provider (never null).
